# Testing

1. [Introduction](#introduction)
2. [ECDSA](#ecdsa)
   1. [3-of-5](#3-of-5)

      2. [Signing](#signing)
   2. [2-of-3](#2-of-3)

      2. [Signing](#signing-1)
3. [EdDSA](#eddsa)
   1. [3-of-5](#3-of-5-1)
      1. [Key Generation](#key-generation-2)
      2. [Signing](#signing-2)

## Introduction

The following document contains simulations of real world signing application
using the `ggmpc` command line utility. We will start with a 3-of-5 setup which
has a general workflow that can be applied to all scenarios, then move on to a
2-of-3 setup that has some optimizations only possible in a scenario where there
is a single pair of players in the signing phase.

## ECDSA

### 3-of-5

This example uses 5 players with a signing threshold of 3. Before the protocol
begins, each player chooses an index.

#### Key Generation

The first phase of the protocol involves generating key shares. This results in
each player having a *p-share* that is private and *n-shares* that will be
distributed to the other players.

Alice chooses index 1 and generates her key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keyshare -i 1 -t 3 -n 5

Save for yourself: pshc_i1_

Send to player 2: nshc_i2j1_

Send to player 3: nshc_i3j1_

Send to player 4: nshc_i4j1_

Send to player 5: nshc_i5j1_
```

Bob chooses index 2 and generates his key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keyshare -i 2 -t 3 -n 3

Save for yourself: pshc_i2_

Send to player 1: nshc_i1j2_

Send to player 3: nshc_i3j2_

Send to player 4: nshc_i4j2_

Send to player 5: nshc_i5j2_
```

Carol chooses index 3 and generates her key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keyshare -i 3 -t 3 -n 5

Save for yourself: pshc_i3_

Send to player 1: nshc_i1j3_

Send to player 2: nshc_i2j3_

Send to player 4: nshc_i4j3_

Send to player 5: nshc_i5j3_
```

The fourth and fifth signers do the same using indices 4 and 5. Their results
are omitted for brevity.

After exchanging their n-shares, the next phase of the key generation protocol
is to combine shares. This results in each player having an *x-share* and
*y-shares*.

Alice combines her p-share with the n-shares she received from the other 
players.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keycombine \
pshc_i1_ \
nshc_i1j2_ \
nshc_i1j3_ \
nshc_i1j4_ \
nshc_i1j5_

Save for yourself: xshc_i1_

Save for player 2: yshc_i1j2_

Save for player 3: yshc_i1j3_

Save for player 4: yshc_i1j4_

Save for player 5: yshc_i1j5_
```

Bob combines his p-share with the n-shares he received from the other players.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keycombine \
pshc_i2_ \
nshc_i2j1_ \
nshc_i2j3_ \
nshc_i2j4_ \
nshc_i2j5_

Save for yourself: xshc_i2_

Save for player 1: yshc_i2j1_

Save for player 3: yshc_i2j3_

Save for player 4: yshc_i2j4_

Save for player 5: yshc_i2j5_
```

Carol combines her p-share with the n-shares she received from the other
players.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keycombine \
pshc_i3_ \
nshc_i3j1_ \
nshc_i3j2_ \
nshc_i3j4_ \
nshc_i3j5_

Save for yourself: xshc_i3_

Save for player 1: yshc_i3j1_

Save for player 2: yshc_i3j2_

Save for player 4: yshc_i3j4_

Save for player 5: yshc_i3j5_
```

At this point, the players do **not** distribute any shares. Instead, the
players save both their x-share and y-shares for the first phase of the signing
protocol.

#### Signing

Alice, Bob, and Carol decide they want to sign something. They begin the
signing protocol by generating signing shares. This results in each signer 
having a *w-share* that is private. Each signer also produces *k-shares*, one
for each other signer, however, only one k-shares for each signing pair will be
used (more on that later).

Alice uses her x-share and the y-shares she has stored for Bob and Carol to
generate her signing shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signshare \
xshc_i1_ \
yshc_i1j2_ \
yshc_i1j3_

Save for yourself: wshc_i1_

Send to player 2: kshc_i2j1_

Send to player 3: kshc_i3j1_
```

Bob uses his x-share and the y-shares he has stored for Alice and Carol to
generate his signing shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signshare \
xshc_i2_ \
yshc_i2j1_ \
yshc_i2j3_

Save for yourself: wshc_i2_

Send to player 1: kshc_i1j2_

Send to player 3: kshc_i3j2_
```

Carol uses her x-share and the y-shares she has stored for Alice and Bob to
generate her signing shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signshare \
xshc_i3_ \
yshc_i3j1_ \
yshc_i3j2_

Save for yourself: wshc_i3_

Send to player 1: kshc_i1j3_

Send to player 2: kshc_i2j3_
```

Each signer now performs pairwise multiplicative-to-addititive share
conversion with the other signers. This involves several round trips and begins
with one signer sending their k-share to the other signer in the pair. The
recipient then performs the first step of the conversion process. This results
in that signer having a *beta-share* that is private and an *alpha-share* that
is sent to the other signer in the pair.

Alice sends Bob the k-share she generated for their signing pair. Bob then
begins the conversion using his w-share and Alice's k-share. 

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
wshc_i2_ \
kshc_i2j1_

Save for yourself: bshc_i2j1_

Send to player 1: ashc_i1j2_
```

Bob saves the beta-share for the next phase and sends the alpha-share to Alice.
The next phase of the conversion is for the recipient to perform MtA of the
sender's shares. This results in the recipient having a *gamma-share* that is
private and a *mu-share* that is returned to the other signer.

Alice performs MtA using her w-share and the alpha-share she received from Bob.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
wshc_i1_ \
ashc_i1j2_

Save for yourself: gshc_i1j2_

Send to player 2: mshc_i2j1_
```

Alice then saves the gamma-share and sends the mu-share to Bob. The next stage
of the conversion process is for the recipient to compute their own gamma-share
using their saved beta-share and the mu-share they received from the other
signer.

Bob computes his gamma-share using his saved beta-share and the mu-share he
received from Alice.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
bshc_i2j1_ \
mshc_i2j1_

Save for yourself: gshc_i2j1_
```

Now Alice has a private gamma-share for her conversion with Bob and Bob has a
private gamma-share for his conversion with Alice.

Alice sends Carol the k-share she generated for their signing pair. Carol then
begins the conversion using her w-share and Alice's k-share.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
wshc_i3_ \
kshc_i3j1_

Save for yourself: bshc_i3j1_

Send to player 1: ashc_i1j3_
```

Carol saves the beta-share and sends the alpha-share to Alice. Alice performs
MtA using her w-share and the alpha-share she received from Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
wshc_i1_ \
ashc_i1j3_

Save for yourself: gshc_i1j3_

Send to player 3: mshc_i3j1_
```

Alice saves the gamma-share and sends the mu-share to Carol. Carol computes her
gamma-share using her saved beta-share and the mu-share she received from
Alice.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
bshc_i3j1_ \
mshc_i3j1_

Save for yourself: gshc_i3j1_
```

Now Alice has a private gamma-share for her conversion with Carol and Carol has
a private gamma-share for her conversion with Alice.

Bob sends Carol the k-share he generated for their signing pair. Carol then
begins the conversion using her w-share and Bob's k-share.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
wshc_i3_ \
kshc_i3j2_

Save for yourself: bshc_i3j2_

Send to player 2: ashc_i2j3_
```

Carol saves the beta-share and sends the alpha-share to Bob. Bob performs MtA
using his w-share and the alpha-share he received from Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
wshc_i2_ \
ashc_i2j3_

Save for yourself: gshc_i2j3_

Send to player 3: mshc_i3j2_
```

Bob saves the gamma-share and sends the mu-share to Carol. Carol computes her
gamma-share using her saved beta-share and the mu-share she received from Bob.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
bshc_i3j2_ \
mshc_i3j2_

Save for yourself: gshc_i3j2_
```

Now Bob has a private gamma-share for his conversion with Carol and Carol has
a private gamma-share for her conversion with Bob.

Once all signers have a gamma-share for each signing pair, the gamma-shares
can be combined to produce an *omicron-share* that is private and a
*delta-share* that is distributed to all other signers.

Alice combines her gamma-shares for her conversions with Bob and Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signcombine \
gshc_i1j2_ \
gshc_i1j3_

Save for yourself: oshc_i1_FHZxPEvPnb69jzhMtuiNQp19mXApW6T5QsdmCBdvtDfMLmp9YUz6hdNiwk9PxyjEsG7p8UkFGVq5odDRiCfNPhvjYGNghn2rvB8BsL1LUA6dMbT3QTXxbjFqX6fDnW3VvYeE7Mbfr2xVozg4o9PtkW3LD7soytT2tB8iXbhPTnB1bAYSofmBdb1JM3Uy84AnNBPUhhGYxZX47M2zhJCW63kpvXdpy1J4kF

Send to player 2: dshc_i2j1_33sPWa8aWnpbHP83ZcNrrXFpFyisdgA7JHSq5JUD93L9nKJam3ZsTS318aTYfkJt4FF5tzLbjoSNEvdNwyCsGi6H2srwzSJ

Send to player 3: dshc_i3j1_33sPWa8aWnpbHP83ZcNrrXFpFyisdgA7JHSq5JUD93L9nKJam3ZsTS318aTYfkJt4FF5tzLbjoSNEvdNwyCsGi6H2srwzSJ
```

Independently, Bob combines his gamma-shares for his conversions with Alice and
Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signcombine \
gshc_i2j1_ \
gshc_i2j3_

Save for yourself: oshc_i2_FHZxPEvPnb69jzhMtuiNQp19mXApW6T5QsdmCBdvtDfMMSn2TcWTrE5RJ6KUHPF2rKtvTPPzN5ugPuywHJ8jG4PqJRbRzeqKqyQPNvwKFhtW2Ek3NikJbkUHxuU8Bv3bDdcfaDDdZUPQpE5uhHY8YYiDFd7RFYvXeGzRisLzDcMywCxJyNBXvpyBMGnxsMTh5VngPK5kvacbQRHUiABLsjvNC5uTmEmuVc

Send to player 1: dshc_i1j2_29RVanNyS25VoTeTtdzYwRKSczPwZhajVoqa91BA2QqcysEM9Gj7PoVGm9b77zxPg1SYW5eyhCvUb6gDUG6pCK2Jo6hyA54

Send to player 3: dshc_i3j2_29RVanNyS25VoTeTtdzYwRKSczPwZhajVoqa91BA2QqcysEM9Gj7PoVGm9b77zxPg1SYW5eyhCvUb6gDUG6pCK2Jo6hyA54
```

Carol likewise independently combines her gamma-shares for her conversions with
Alice and Bob.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signcombine \
gshc_i3j1_ \
gshc_i3j2_

Save for yourself: oshc_i3_FHZxPEvPnb69jzhMtuiNQp19mXApW6T5QsdmCBdvtDfMMHvP9QRx34vX4g2vpU82uJj5PVyciX5xvrMaEgACSuG6u1rK7WGqphWpey5pXmqpPG1tjFeCVgVYYxZ1TmyiLP1U6bL4CTCLbFVbYjMLbZLfwaCkVamQEZJerjzxMaTewRFedGKvznXSKRGQThteo16Tn3BPdftsCPJ9ki6K25uRCzxy4ezpvY

Send to player 1: dshc_i1j3_29sUVQ3beAJXbjTNeWyssJBBPjzTuQduBwT9THwWz6EV57nmAh5uUxkVgcmctnMHoRsKZbGc3E8N82byJWhWAU7yaF5adVt

Send to player 2: dshc_i2j3_29sUVQ3beAJXbjTNeWyssJBBPjzTuQduBwT9THwWz6EV57nmAh5uUxkVgcmctnMHoRsKZbGc3E8N82byJWhWAU7yaF5adVt
```

Alice, Bob, and Carol exchange delta-shares. The next phase of the protocol is
for the signers to use their private omicron-share with the delta-shares to
produce a signature share. This results in each signer having an *s-share* that
is distributed to all other signers.

Alice signs the message using her private omicron-share and the delta-shares
she received from Bob and Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa sign "Hello, world!" \
oshc_i1_FHZxPEvPnb69jzhMtuiNQp19mXApW6T5QsdmCBdvtDfMLmp9YUz6hdNiwk9PxyjEsG7p8UkFGVq5odDRiCfNPhvjYGNghn2rvB8BsL1LUA6dMbT3QTXxbjFqX6fDnW3VvYeE7Mbfr2xVozg4o9PtkW3LD7soytT2tB8iXbhPTnB1bAYSofmBdb1JM3Uy84AnNBPUhhGYxZX47M2zhJCW63kpvXdpy1J4kF \
dshc_i1j2_29RVanNyS25VoTeTtdzYwRKSczPwZhajVoqa91BA2QqcysEM9Gj7PoVGm9b77zxPg1SYW5eyhCvUb6gDUG6pCK2Jo6hyA54 \
dshc_i1j3_29sUVQ3beAJXbjTNeWyssJBBPjzTuQduBwT9THwWz6EV57nmAh5uUxkVgcmctnMHoRsKZbGc3E8N82byJWhWAU7yaF5adVt

Send to all players: sshc_i1_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrGKNitokWCBV8BonTmtfzYa2P6SLQNH8fUCED9udPVWfuwqkvbt
```

Bob signs the message using his private omicron-share and the delta-shares he
received from Alice and Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa sign "Hello, world!" \
oshc_i2_FHZxPEvPnb69jzhMtuiNQp19mXApW6T5QsdmCBdvtDfMMSn2TcWTrE5RJ6KUHPF2rKtvTPPzN5ugPuywHJ8jG4PqJRbRzeqKqyQPNvwKFhtW2Ek3NikJbkUHxuU8Bv3bDdcfaDDdZUPQpE5uhHY8YYiDFd7RFYvXeGzRisLzDcMywCxJyNBXvpyBMGnxsMTh5VngPK5kvacbQRHUiABLsjvNC5uTmEmuVc \
dshc_i2j1_33sPWa8aWnpbHP83ZcNrrXFpFyisdgA7JHSq5JUD93L9nKJam3ZsTS318aTYfkJt4FF5tzLbjoSNEvdNwyCsGi6H2srwzSJ \
dshc_i2j3_29sUVQ3beAJXbjTNeWyssJBBPjzTuQduBwT9THwWz6EV57nmAh5uUxkVgcmctnMHoRsKZbGc3E8N82byJWhWAU7yaF5adVt

Send to all players: sshc_i2_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrG2wA9wJ1nW2F9s9zdZ5VwTqTKCDW5gxayZ72AGMwCvG9yVNRJa
```

Carol signs the message using her private omicron-share and the delta-shares 
she received from Alice and Bob.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa sign "Hello, world!" \
oshc_i3_FHZxPEvPnb69jzhMtuiNQp19mXApW6T5QsdmCBdvtDfMMHvP9QRx34vX4g2vpU82uJj5PVyciX5xvrMaEgACSuG6u1rK7WGqphWpey5pXmqpPG1tjFeCVgVYYxZ1TmyiLP1U6bL4CTCLbFVbYjMLbZLfwaCkVamQEZJerjzxMaTewRFedGKvznXSKRGQThteo16Tn3BPdftsCPJ9ki6K25uRCzxy4ezpvY \
dshc_i3j1_33sPWa8aWnpbHP83ZcNrrXFpFyisdgA7JHSq5JUD93L9nKJam3ZsTS318aTYfkJt4FF5tzLbjoSNEvdNwyCsGi6H2srwzSJ \
dshc_i3j2_29RVanNyS25VoTeTtdzYwRKSczPwZhajVoqa91BA2QqcysEM9Gj7PoVGm9b77zxPg1SYW5eyhCvUb6gDUG6pCK2Jo6hyA54

Send to all players: sshc_i3_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrFGV9F95ZtQPNQTUSznM5UGfMCaMbKn5tn4J96GCiWAdHradAzc
```

Alice, Bob, and Carol then exchange s-shares. Finally the complete signature
can be reconstructed with the s-shares of all signers.

Alice, Bob, and Carol independently use the s-shares to reconstruct the final
signature.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signcombine \
sshc_i1_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrGKNitokWCBV8BonTmtfzYa2P6SLQNH8fUCED9udPVWfuwqkvbt \
sshc_i2_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrG2wA9wJ1nW2F9s9zdZ5VwTqTKCDW5gxayZ72AGMwCvG9yVNRJa \
sshc_i3_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrFGV9F95ZtQPNQTUSznM5UGfMCaMbKn5tn4J96GCiWAdHradAzc

sigc_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrFKx7nfnEZPDN8yLxxdegduBiEvruJQET6w5eN3s4Dfa6QpFfdf
```

Anyone with the message and signature can verify.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa verify "Hello, world!" \
sigc_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrFKx7nfnEZPDN8yLxxdegduBiEvruJQET6w5eN3s4Dfa6QpFfdf

Verification succeeded
```

You can use the `deserialize` command to view the fields of the signature. This
command works for any piece of data returned from the `ggmpc` utility.

```shell
$ ggmpc deserialize \
sigc_dgGU6XeFqFqsj6TWModWFwvMsw7XvbPvE81PYgUJhwsjmok1ZipNgfhTAwgR4AsR92fiKnsCKTs8LXJ4LixduNrFKx7nfnEZPDN8yLxxdegduBiEvruJQET6w5eN3s4Dfa6QpFfdf

{
  "y": "03afb91124ec8fb7f95f5018eb05583ac8baaaf4c5436e1ec6fa5e835bb9240e51",
  "r": "9c424f1572aa59793943f0e12f19d8ca23479b6db95c02286a596df5efb297ee",
  "s": "0a1af4e3db99d851a96fccd8a7f8ec1fc7e8139fed9005309c57a595ac4839bd"
}
```

### 2-of-3

This example uses 3 players with a signing threshold of 2.

#### Key Generation

Alice chooses index 1 and generates her key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keyshare -i 1 -t 2 -n 3

Save for yourself: pshc_i1_

Send to player 2: nshc_i2j1_

Send to player 3: nshc_i3j1_
```

Bob chooses index 2 and generates his key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keyshare -i 2 -t 2 -n 3

Save for yourself: pshc_i2_

Send to player 1: nshc_i1j2_

Send to player 3: nshc_i3j2_
```

Carol chooses index 3 and generates her key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keyshare -i 3 -t 2 -n 3

Save for yourself: pshc_i3_

Send to player 1: nshc_i1j3_

Send to player 2: nshc_i2j3_
```

Alice combines her p-share with the n-shares she received from Bob and Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keycombine \
pshc_i1_ \
nshc_i1j2_ \
nshc_i1j3_

Save for yourself: xshc_i1_

Save for player 2: yshc_i1j2_

Save for player 3: yshc_i1j3_
```

Bob combines his p-share with the n-shares he received from Alice and Carol.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keycombine \
pshc_i2_ \
nshc_i2j1_ \
nshc_i2j3_

Save for yourself: xshc_i2_

Save for player 1: yshc_i2j1_

Save for player 3: yshc_i2j3_
```

Carol combines her p-share with the n-shares she received from Alice and Bob.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa keycombine \
pshc_i3_ \
nshc_i3j1_ \
nshc_i3j2_

Save for yourself: xshc_i3_

Save for player 1: yshc_i3j1_

Save for player 2: yshc_i3j2_
```

#### Signing

Alice and Bob decide they want to sign something.

Alice uses her x-share and the y-share she has stored for Bob to generate her
signing shares:

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signshare \
xshc_i1_ \
yshc_i1j2_

Save for yourself: wshc_i1_

Send to player 2: kshc_i2j1_
```

As previously seen in the 3-of-5 example, each player needs to generate a
(w-share, k-share) tuple for every signing pair. In a 2-of-\* setup, it may be
desirable for one of the signers not to precompute this tuple at all. Just as in
3-of-3, one of the signers' k-shares is never used in 2-of-\*. Additionally, in
2-of-\*, the recipient of the k-share has no need of storing their w-share since
they will never use it for another signing pair. For this scenario, the
`signconvert` command has a shortcut that allows the receipient of the k-share
to compute the beta-share and alpha-share directly from an (x-share, y-share,
k-share) tuple.

Alice sends Bob her k-share. Bob then begins the conversion using his x-share,
the y-share he has stored for Alice, and the k-share he received from Alice.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
xshc_i2_ \
yshc_i2j1_ \
kshc_i2j1_

Save for yourself: bshc_i2j1_

Send to player 1: ashc_i1j2_
```

Bob saves the beta-share and sends the alpha-share to Alice. Alice performs MtA
using her w-share and the alpha-share she received from Bob.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
wshc_i1_ \
ashc_i1j2_

Save for yourself: gshc_i1j2_

Send to player 2: mshc_i2j1_
```

Alice then saves the gamma-share and sends the mu-share to Bob. Bob computes
his gamma-share using his saved beta-share and the mu-share he received from
Alice.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signconvert \
bshc_i2j1_ \
mshc_i2j1_

Save for yourself: gshc_i2j1_
```

Alice combines her gamma-shares. Note that the signing threshold of our setup
is 2, so there is only one signing pair and thus Alice has only one
gamma-share.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signcombine \
gshc_i1j2_

Save for yourself: oshc_i1_FkMRpWznmYyeRedwXSRCrmMUCghZwc7EkCj5ao4VvBN2pQD86KjxM6dBtdY5cMhwwrxaiBLgRG5z1u2kVtTuXz2PRPm972gHvwSNRWgzZHUhuWuTEzyqZatCn2aV7U7tr9jMagP2t2HoASYqFcSMNDGDy5Y4onP9Hi5YM9oKPKN7YVgWtmBg7b1chSoZMDtzL7C9ErRQ4ZDwQURwFUdifYmX9jCKSbosMd

Send to player 2: dshc_i2j1_2FqheUCRF2bWCai96C8PcUvaC6cFJPJssfm6nqXWA8zdy5KLzaS9YTzbVsKYXH2sbpuAC1fNpYozwjuKR8wkHDg7MQaccBQ
```

Independently, Bob combines his gamma-shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signcombine \
gshc_i2j1_

Save for yourself: oshc_i2_FkMRpWznmYyeRedwXSRCrmMUCghZwc7EkCj5ao4VvBN2uF6zf4q6hjrhEnBdQ4y5XwNV3a73YP742tWJ4nu6rmkmy4KPd5camUvwfQEJmyqbLJx4a4qJsCRdMieu5J2ZHozE7nnLQy2Fa853hycv2jFXHboo1BrW928yeqkRimj9nvePt5JPpaZvXtZU6X81pG8vcAC66ZgPzAwPuPenCMnQCLt419CZaD

Send to player 1: dshc_i1j2_2p3vRWHWsouJP5hJHByi7PEBSaFFtANJQzJPwj9Me4GYgiswGmZLh32pX4wUP8SrszaZzZ5SbCaTPPkJHpJ2JnzoMma1B2
```

Alice and Bob exchange delta-shares. Alice signs the message using her private
omicron-share and the delta-share she received from Bob.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa sign "Hello, world!" \
oshc_i1_FkMRpWznmYyeRedwXSRCrmMUCghZwc7EkCj5ao4VvBN2pQD86KjxM6dBtdY5cMhwwrxaiBLgRG5z1u2kVtTuXz2PRPm972gHvwSNRWgzZHUhuWuTEzyqZatCn2aV7U7tr9jMagP2t2HoASYqFcSMNDGDy5Y4onP9Hi5YM9oKPKN7YVgWtmBg7b1chSoZMDtzL7C9ErRQ4ZDwQURwFUdifYmX9jCKSbosMd \
dshc_i1j2_2p3vRWHWsouJP5hJHByi7PEBSaFFtANJQzJPwj9Me4GYgiswGmZLh32pX4wUP8SrszaZzZ5SbCaTPPkJHpJ2JnzoMma1B2

Send to all players: sshc_i1_es2rbjVNjxPsbzUT1qRACMmaZXwjLkZ3ZdM5vYKwsBJVPewD25SYng9U5B1HZPnbbpK1VQmrRHm6oaBdk5pUufnrv31BvYxLPWnAhYWrtc6e3kP5UCBvJgW9YxPsHNuULLa7xdTQ5
``

Bob signs the message using his private omicron-share and the delta-share he
received from Alice.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa sign "Hello, world!" \
oshc_i2_FkMRpWznmYyeRedwXSRCrmMUCghZwc7EkCj5ao4VvBN2uF6zf4q6hjrhEnBdQ4y5XwNV3a73YP742tWJ4nu6rmkmy4KPd5camUvwfQEJmyqbLJx4a4qJsCRdMieu5J2ZHozE7nnLQy2Fa853hycv2jFXHboo1BrW928yeqkRimj9nvePt5JPpaZvXtZU6X81pG8vcAC66ZgPzAwPuPenCMnQCLt419CZaD \
dshc_i2j1_2FqheUCRF2bWCai96C8PcUvaC6cFJPJssfm6nqXWA8zdy5KLzaS9YTzbVsKYXH2sbpuAC1fNpYozwjuKR8wkHDg7MQaccBQ

Send to all players: sshc_i2_es2rbjVNjxPsbzUT1qRACMmaZXwjLkZ3ZdM5vYKwsBJVPewD25SYng9U5B1HZPnbbpK1VQmrRHm6oaBdk5pUufntbgvSCFJd7n6DFY9U9yYAsKYe6BBjJBkMfCotoDHHSskYiDxNu
```

Alice and Bob then exchange s-shares. Finally the complete signature can be
reconstructed by the s-shares of all signers.

Alice and Bob independently use the s-shares to reconstruct the final
signature.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa signcombine \
sshc_i1_es2rbjVNjxPsbzUT1qRACMmaZXwjLkZ3ZdM5vYKwsBJVPewD25SYng9U5B1HZPnbbpK1VQmrRHm6oaBdk5pUufnrv31BvYxLPWnAhYWrtc6e3kP5UCBvJgW9YxPsHNuULLa7xdTQ5 \
sshc_i2_es2rbjVNjxPsbzUT1qRACMmaZXwjLkZ3ZdM5vYKwsBJVPewD25SYng9U5B1HZPnbbpK1VQmrRHm6oaBdk5pUufntbgvSCFJd7n6DFY9U9yYAsKYe6BBjJBkMfCotoDHHSskYiDxNu

sigc_es2rbjVNjxPsbzUT1qRACMmaZXwjLkZ3ZdM5vYKwsBJVPewD25SYng9U5B1HZPnbbpK1VQmrRHm6oaBdk5pUufnrooNJ4XVRiKfdyN9uuoCjFzeqZP7RmdcMNRZ2veL8NVKJk826B
```

Anyone with the message and signature can verify.

```shell
$ ggmpc ecdsa verify "Hello, world!" \
sigc_es2rbjVNjxPsbzUT1qRACMmaZXwjLkZ3ZdM5vYKwsBJVPewD25SYng9U5B1HZPnbbpK1VQmrRHm6oaBdk5pUufnrooNJ4XVRiKfdyN9uuoCjFzeqZP7RmdcMNRZ2veL8NVKJk826B

Verification succeeded
```

## EdDSA

### 3-of-5

#### Key Generation

The first phase of the protocol involves generating key shares. This results in
each player having a *u-share* that is private and *y-shares* that will be
distributed to the other players.

Alice chooses index 1 and generates her key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa keyshare -i 1 -t 2 -n 3

Save for yourself: ushd_i1_2MNHKtKRQ45aZjNQZYsNr5gWs9MQdkFaFHHaQDnaQhWgX4jjKJp5qnoP9X67f4wrM9Zshw2n7Q8YE6jbXMhmRpKBHJJgtR7X5AuwJLJ3LLoHuThP4z2p7E4As5GZPNGNd1cNvKoR6

Send to player 2: yshd_i2j1_5YonKYSgsBgHVuqJcyEfrDVGnKJySQykp1aCHMoc81xtYYvPZzD6qpnKwtCDeocKJ4pPjK1fQAwhEBjRU5ViqTmqP9Yht

Send to player 3: yshd_i3j1_5YonKYSgsBgHVuqJcyEfrDVGnKJySQykp1aCHMoc81xtWKG2W6uvsXsgX5qJwET5BXSGZiW1aaRPyCJakMQTziwvroBUt

Send to player 4: yshd_i4j1_5YonKYSgsBgHVuqJcyEfrDVGnKJySQykp1aCHMoc81xtWT591G8tY48dR7GHZUqyxsBXAw2pEuoHh536yrcMePmDnc39T

Send to player 5: yshd_i5j1_5YonKYSgsBgHVuqJcyEfrDVGnKJySQykp1aCHMoc81xtYxMj5TsyqPZAdxV9XYo3e649Yxc5PB5NPovzAb7PnUDhM4uuV
```

Bob chooses index 2 and generates his key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa keyshare -i 2 -t 2 -n 3

Save for yourself: ushd_i2_AUgBQgndp5JTGGz2aH17dLnpihD88QyioEK29WvKL6Hnatxoms6NTdQxvQpfK8K4DGKabeTYaxZo78F2C5bNHhQXcojHjqKHKpnf9t2Jx3hB4ipHVnPGYE8MaXpvVCqE7bYx4Tp23

Send to player 1: yshd_i1j2_YuNcmuMLasu6TKXkUwvLvEZ24G9T5qpceRmwM8XBa7EEszyJ3iwNzqbC5ZckVv6zby1QSea1zDBPKPQup2fTPGC32njFb

Send to player 3: yshd_i3j2_YuNcmuMLasu6TKXkUwvLvEZ24G9T5qpceRmwM8XBa7EEyYaC6d1ZJ6pHTos1oDBPf4g4k31bqZX2c6KqG7iTD5ehneYP1

Send to player 4: yshd_i4j2_YuNcmuMLasu6TKXkUwvLvEZ24G9T5qpceRmwM8XBa7EEsqu2JyZq7AxZ814aYfXykBM7JVRGEt91qvEUXDk5T6EFLReoY

Send to player 5: yshd_i5j2_YuNcmuMLasu6TKXkUwvLvEZ24G9T5qpceRmwM8XBa7EEtEjdiXAR4CwuvThVXnM3goVbwRPE7Vdqf9czyL1dviCaBqMbm
```

Carol chooses index 3 and generates her key shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa keyshare -i 3 -t 2 -n 3

Save for yourself: ushd_i3_3Nre7VgbKLu37TM9pjkgjZjFwNkrbwt7u3hDHYGzpM4NWWrAKCRFf4QpnqS8tKiNftFx2mE7R5hpA49Jt6rj7iheHWtNSaVA3a3FK1o2FZnFAvy9r8rNyTMwmv9Ru5etZ7AKtrbnu

Send to player 1: yshd_i1j3_914iwQ9SoS3xM8k5hxzhP16KRrKb6NE1qfrP8RyHcLv8a6Q9JFkt7nK6vVGvRJVe88x3W1NFq37P4Q31FJyFHi7Cn264r

Send to player 2: yshd_i2j3_914iwQ9SoS3xM8k5hxzhP16KRrKb6NE1qfrP8RyHcLv8ZdDBdYNgKFV3ZrHweABmkreCcNaD6hui4WfjkSjW94RFPstNe

Send to player 4: yshd_i4j3_914iwQ9SoS3xM8k5hxzhP16KRrKb6NE1qfrP8RyHcLv8Ysa45g4Hpj13wtHoYGJJmyo9VUfF6kEasn9YymLeV7btAFa1b

Send to player 5: yshd_i5j3_914iwQ9SoS3xM8k5hxzhP16KRrKb6NE1qfrP8RyHcLv8Yb7tCX878jM7gZGeDWiiAPFwGDYKq7m8gvzdhxBXypUafefLm
```

The fourth and fifth signers do the same using indices 4 and 5. Their results
are omitted for brevity.

After exchanging their y-shares, the next phase of the key generation protocol
is to combine shares. This results in each player having a *p-share* and
*j-shares*.

Alice combines her u-share with the y-shares she received from the other
players.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa keycombine \
ushd_i1_2MNHKtKRQ45aZjNQZYsNr5gWs9MQdkFaFHHaQDnaQhWgX4jjKJp5qnoP9X67f4wrM9Zshw2n7Q8YE6jbXMhmRpKBHJJgtR7X5AuwJLJ3LLoHuThP4z2p7E4As5GZPNGNd1cNvKoR6 \
yshd_i1j2_YuNcmuMLasu6TKXkUwvLvEZ24G9T5qpceRmwM8XBa7EEszyJ3iwNzqbC5ZckVv6zby1QSea1zDBPKPQup2fTPGC32njFb \
yshd_i1j3_914iwQ9SoS3xM8k5hxzhP16KRrKb6NE1qfrP8RyHcLv8a6Q9JFkt7nK6vVGvRJVe88x3W1NFq37P4Q31FJyFHi7Cn264r \
yshd_i1j4_XYatKwbv6KzPtDnrgA2bW5HKY5Gg5gVTGkjJu6nVeM1AL6yjSXdRVexzc7GbRJKKxLu2Y11cMY9syHDxKpnxjs5Gv7kDB \
yshd_i1j5_RTWKLLtsLqNkS8RNpavseNV9AwLgYZimranHZqFTuav8JQX9PWXkmPysfJMdCRSuSwUcjqpSTW9XDBvdLir4A4iw1hmRh

Save for yourself: pshd_i1_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVbQRzR2A6KCsGTQZVwFPSQx1nDVB8LS7UVbu9TXKHfqbvW473UAoWxUgZT5PnwbcaS6qFLyAmR7WCjt1dPBmb1vrnfb1R8

Save for player 2: jshd_i2j1

Save for player 3: jshd_i3j1

Save for player 4: jshd_i4j1

Save for player 5: jshd_i5j1
```

Bob combines his u-share with the y-shares he received from the other players.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa keycombine \
ushd_i2_AUgBQgndp5JTGGz2aH17dLnpihD88QyioEK29WvKL6Hnatxoms6NTdQxvQpfK8K4DGKabeTYaxZo78F2C5bNHhQXcojHjqKHKpnf9t2Jx3hB4ipHVnPGYE8MaXpvVCqE7bYx4Tp23 \
yshd_i2j1_5YonKYSgsBgHVuqJcyEfrDVGnKJySQykp1aCHMoc81xtYYvPZzD6qpnKwtCDeocKJ4pPjK1fQAwhEBjRU5ViqTmqP9Yht \
yshd_i2j3_914iwQ9SoS3xM8k5hxzhP16KRrKb6NE1qfrP8RyHcLv8ZdDBdYNgKFV3ZrHweABmkreCcNaD6hui4WfjkSjW94RFPstNe \
yshd_i2j4_XYatKwbv6KzPtDnrgA2bW5HKY5Gg5gVTGkjJu6nVeM1AEWGqxSsjEjL6M44tjZidCLZNRupqg2CNkSmpNUfqz2sfmZwTW \
yshd_i2j5_RTWKLLtsLqNkS8RNpavseNV9AwLgYZimranHZqFTuav8JYzTGeAbdy7HWQmkBiFFvqDqtq5mUesUzLyUQmGZs24czGvLG

Save for yourself: pshd_i2_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVbLRyHq9BRCNjbhc1YHs2TQ5ehaGq6ZDUxkxsGcHTmVjKUEBVLNL8i4mHDfuJD36vr976FhoB7pMfWG6NC9CKyamKXnxmJ

Save for player 1: jshd_i1j2

Save for player 3: jshd_i3j2

Save for player 4: jshd_i4j2

Save for player 5: jshd_i5j2
```

Carol combines her u-share with the y-shares she received from the other
players.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa keycombine \
ushd_i3_3Nre7VgbKLu37TM9pjkgjZjFwNkrbwt7u3hDHYGzpM4NWWrAKCRFf4QpnqS8tKiNftFx2mE7R5hpA49Jt6rj7iheHWtNSaVA3a3FK1o2FZnFAvy9r8rNyTMwmv9Ru5etZ7AKtrbnu \
yshd_i3j1_5YonKYSgsBgHVuqJcyEfrDVGnKJySQykp1aCHMoc81xtWKG2W6uvsXsgX5qJwET5BXSGZiW1aaRPyCJakMQTziwvroBUt \
yshd_i3j2_YuNcmuMLasu6TKXkUwvLvEZ24G9T5qpceRmwM8XBa7EEyYaC6d1ZJ6pHTos1oDBPf4g4k31bqZX2c6KqG7iTD5ehneYP1 \
yshd_i3j4_XYatKwbv6KzPtDnrgA2bW5HKY5Gg5gVTGkjJu6nVeM1AEcmAV4qYmNGK6E9tPuyTfMbxF7iXx9AtmMBKaaarFUbL1JF9r \
yshd_i3j5_RTWKLLtsLqNkS8RNpavseNV9AwLgYZimranHZqFTuav8JkouuGq8HFcZJzqY9hAPmS1cU8ogshwd5pahNHmwWuMoEQmEj

Save for yourself: pshd_i3_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVadSUQYygCA8tXWumn4BdqwptjaFbizGiBmxZBQtcWcod2mGua91AKHdTsU3YsU6YxdK5gYkHXfQs2rKNzYB2bN9D6LFRo

Save for player 1: jshd_i1j3

Save for player 2: jshd_i2j3

Save for player 4: jshd_i4j3

Save for player 5: jshd_i5j3
```

At this point, the players do **not** distribute any shares. Instead, the
players save both their p-share and j-shares for the first phase of the signing
protocol.

#### Signing

Alice, Bob, and Carol decide they want to sign something. They begin the
signing protocol by generating shares of an ephemeral key. This results in each
signer  having an *x-share* that is private and *r-shares* to be distributed to
the other signers.

Alice uses her p-share and the j-shares she has stored for Bob and Carol to
generate her signing shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa signshare "Hello, world!" \
pshd_i1_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVbQRzR2A6KCsGTQZVwFPSQx1nDVB8LS7UVbu9TXKHfqbvW473UAoWxUgZT5PnwbcaS6qFLyAmR7WCjt1dPBmb1vrnfb1R8 \
jshd_i2j1 \
jshd_i3j1

Save for yourself: xshd_i1_2tuRvf3Tnz7ePekjcjAvKxjhPXTnYunM9V7uNVaE8XKqnPQDoRJnufRsb293s5ACUd138q9s4P6bQjMRS3TLfcpqtewQzVwRnacN3tQwxogwvkxwmiFwbZy4UwsG4Z8g2eK9t49QuvfVRE9FgzrFxtPFRsLHxv8rPhe2jDa3iqhocJ414ozSB

Send to player 2: rshd_i2j1_29GN6gpwZF9j31tGoBE92gudvYASMBAaLKgnbdcZgfvazq36pbo7BwyP5GtKL5kf62qgFyMRf6GLgJL6xkWtMk7o1RfW5

Send to player 3: rshd_i3j1_28pqWtJtm3zqFUQemQZnKL6b2kTSor7ufh1QmLsVbv3Lc6vPuyAbhw2qKmxaJENF9MbQwXTRPC2LhkUDzTqu75EJqUxix
```

Bob uses his p-share and the j-shares he has stored for Alice and Carol to
generate his signing shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa signshare "Hello, world!" \
pshd_i2_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVbLRyHq9BRCNjbhc1YHs2TQ5ehaGq6ZDUxkxsGcHTmVjKUEBVLNL8i4mHDfuJD36vr976FhoB7pMfWG6NC9CKyamKXnxmJ \
jshd_i1j2 \
jshd_i3j2

Save for yourself: xshd_i2_2tuRvf3Tnz7ePekjcjAvKxjhPXTnYunM9V7uNVaE8XKqnNDJCa8FcXxvhPenKcATv9PnKTzwUZMqpoCx9H58ujXp5iunK4XDnwfDPr4CG9CedLhhSsS74VJ7ZhB3orD3CR2JYtV5q1w9cWuozpwUkjqGM8XKETmZVrWEY24opees3whwBtmJ4

Send to player 1: rshd_i1j2_oH1Myn3xWiahK9WBw8qERw9TmB8cpH7SnBDfDwCJZ3dH8JDoicWnKcWxj2RACwzXdc6VoJrHs93u41gTDEJNUnwGt6kv

Send to player 3: rshd_i3j2_qJ9ZZrRKW4qCzeEYgc4DBS3KXEpPufEfe9DFF2pA8365NRMT6HJL9ZgwZKg2va4SsnNeLbu4DKTqKi8zHAqLrDZKGpeJ
```

Carol uses her p-share and the j-shares she has stored for Alice and Bob to
generate her signing shares.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa signshare "Hello, world!" \

Save for yourself: xshd_i3_2tuRvf3Tnz7ePekjcjAvKxjhPXTnYunM9V7uNVaE8XKqnA32s2mNxyd89mQ568eYLc5w6yEh8hniVqafRz8zpnoUSfRHKtogWD5kvbjFZzGQ5PhwNgGAB4jtcS752doFHQ8RHGSVrZCnrzoyk6S7UEUrrRjsFDKYFoZYBVgDkkaGTcrFqb2Dc

Send to player 1: rshd_i1j3_xBKqZp4ru9MVroD3Sw65UFMzQvmzaYYUbH89LShaUjzkVLZ8MmfBgzWWbnpQzaS9yumYrgWbVWWUnvMvUYywnSKWHmLv

Send to player 2: rshd_i2j3_ELwr8bgzn1876uSdHMYtTJ9jWdGkbcYfJnYPCYQwaK6jNq5eVBTrT1cqvsF1Mfksfuk88eKdPTWeY2yxN23TouhQsqJq
```

Each signer exchanges r-shares. The next stage of the signing protocol is for
each signer to sign the message using their share of the ephemeral key by
combining their x-share and the r-shares they received from the other signers.
This results in each signer having a g-share.

Alice uses her x-share and the r-shares she received from Bob and Carol to
generate her g-share.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa sign "Hello, world!" \
xshd_i1_2tuRvf3Tnz7ePekjcjAvKxjhPXTnYunM9V7uNVaE8XKqnPQDoRJnufRsb293s5ACUd138q9s4P6bQjMRS3TLfcpqtewQzVwRnacN3tQwxogwvkxwmiFwbZy4UwsG4Z8g2eK9t49QuvfVRE9FgzrFxtPFRsLHxv8rPhe2jDa3iqhocJ414ozSB \
rshd_i1j2_oH1Myn3xWiahK9WBw8qERw9TmB8cpH7SnBDfDwCJZ3dH8JDoicWnKcWxj2RACwzXdc6VoJrHs93u41gTDEJNUnwGt6kv \
rshd_i1j3_xBKqZp4ru9MVroD3Sw65UFMzQvmzaYYUbH89LShaUjzkVLZ8MmfBgzWWbnpQzaS9yumYrgWbVWWUnvMvUYywnSKWHmLv

Send to all players: gshd_i1_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVaM9dhvfgxSD9pGhXFCdQvXTM2U2cm69VtvXP25cTeRAqKRGdeoXoHYftw8UNeRHHFsQ8JidYLSriJtWpp6Bj6gVsSieuQ
```

Bob uses his x-share and the r-shares he received from Alice and Carol to
generate his g-share.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa sign "Hello, world!" \
xshd_i2_2tuRvf3Tnz7ePekjcjAvKxjhPXTnYunM9V7uNVaE8XKqnNDJCa8FcXxvhPenKcATv9PnKTzwUZMqpoCx9H58ujXp5iunK4XDnwfDPr4CG9CedLhhSsS74VJ7ZhB3orD3CR2JYtV5q1w9cWuozpwUkjqGM8XKETmZVrWEY24opees3whwBtmJ4 \
rshd_i2j1_29GN6gpwZF9j31tGoBE92gudvYASMBAaLKgnbdcZgfvazq36pbo7BwyP5GtKL5kf62qgFyMRf6GLgJL6xkWtMk7o1RfW5 \
rshd_i2j3_ELwr8bgzn1876uSdHMYtTJ9jWdGkbcYfJnYPCYQwaK6jNq5eVBTrT1cqvsF1Mfksfuk88eKdPTWeY2yxN23TouhQsqJq

```

Carol uses her x-share and r-shares she received from Alice and Bob to generate
her g-share.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa sign "Hello, world!" \
xshd_i3_2tuRvf3Tnz7ePekjcjAvKxjhPXTnYunM9V7uNVaE8XKqnA32s2mNxyd89mQ568eYLc5w6yEh8hniVqafRz8zpnoUSfRHKtogWD5kvbjFZzGQ5PhwNgGAB4jtcS752doFHQ8RHGSVrZCnrzoyk6S7UEUrrRjsFDKYFoZYBVgDkkaGTcrFqb2Dc \
rshd_i3j1_28pqWtJtm3zqFUQemQZnKL6b2kTSor7ufh1QmLsVbv3Lc6vPuyAbhw2qKmxaJENF9MbQwXTRPC2LhkUDzTqu75EJqUxix \
rshd_i3j2_qJ9ZZrRKW4qCzeEYgc4DBS3KXEpPufEfe9DFF2pA8365NRMT6HJL9ZgwZKg2va4SsnNeLbu4DKTqKi8zHAqLrDZKGpeJ

Send to all players: gshd_i3_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVZf8G3m3G2aNBEFvqjLCpFKehnGrcxPdNpK5VH7Hd6U4mZ7W3c7NXJVfXvQza9zNuMTDjWWfkhx4g1wynNDK287yWzpTAK
```

After the signers broadcast their g-shares, the final signature can be
reconstructed independently.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa signcombine \
gshd_i1_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVaM9dhvfgxSD9pGhXFCdQvXTM2U2cm69VtvXP25cTeRAqKRGdeoXoHYftw8UNeRHHFsQ8JidYLSriJtWpp6Bj6gVsSieuQ \
gshd_i2_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVZfhbQvT1KF4Jy3ydpgaHqSx1TJdDgVc1mYwVCBRVfe2mx2wud6hF5e5DPWRcRrsC3ELVx1LEJobPDxpFqezjTHxdRMTpk \
gshd_i3_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvVZf8G3m3G2aNBEFvqjLCpFKehnGrcxPdNpK5VH7Hd6U4mZ7W3c7NXJVfXvQza9zNuMTDjWWfkhx4g1wynNDK287yWzpTAK

sigd_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvW7Kk3f4bkdWkTMKo1PctFqys2sfGSQsmtsLKMRVwb6ksEiz2ZZamYLHxknsfRAgRJud6j23LC9yewpBp5aL6mZGYCKQJXB
```

Anyone with the message and signature can verify.

```shell
$ ggmpc eddsa verify "Hello, world!" \
sigd_7NyF7YNVLyuxPHM3WR2LL3EhTEDSTSM3mZo4zZVcxuvW7Kk3f4bkdWkTMKo1PctFqys2sfGSQsmtsLKMRVwb6ksEiz2ZZamYLHxknsfRAgRJud6j23LC9yewpBp5aL6mZGYCKQJXB

Verification succeeded
```
